intro: Byttneria pedersenii, commonly known as the African sycamore, is a large evergreen tree native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its broad, glossy leaves and showy, yellow flowers. The tree produces woody capsules that contain numerous small, hairy seeds. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils and can grow up to 30 meters in height. Its bark is thick and fissured, providing a distinctive appearance and contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
